brief_summary.textblock: To assess performance of resp rate parameter in a monitoring system PCBA-1

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulse Oximetry- Evaluating Resp Rate- PCBA-1

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Male or female subjects ages 18 or older.

          2. Subject is willing and able to provide written consent.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Subject has severe contact allergies that may cause a reaction to standard adhesive
             materials found in pulse oximetry sensors, ECG electrodes, respiration monitor
             electrodes or other medical sensors.

          2. Subjects with abnormalities that may prevent proper application of the device.

          3. Subjects with significant Arrhythmia, as determined by subject self-report during
             screening and I/E criteria assessment at study start. (Three events of irregularities
             in radial pulse within thirty seconds).

          4. Women who are pregnant or lactating.

clinical_study.official_title: Respiration Rate Parameter Studies in Healthy Volunteers Using a Bedside Respiratory Patient Monitoring System With the Multi-Functional Patient Monitoring PCBA-1

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: ME (mean error) of Respiration Rate values for each subject

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
